merlin.0:
Hello there! 
Welcome to a special quantum world!

merlin.1: I am Merlin. I am here to explain this world.

merlin.2: As you may have noticed, you can use the arrow keys or the 'A' and 'D' keys to move left and right.

merlin.3: You can use the space bar to jump and use 'G' to interact.

merlin.4: On the top left of the screen you can see how many lives you have. Anytime you get hit by an enemy or fall, you will lose a heart and return to the previous checkpoint. Isn't that convenient?

merlin.5: If you lose all your hearts, you will return to the beginning of the level.

merlin.6: Next to the hearts you can see your coins collected. They get reset once you lose all your lives. Every 5 coins you collect will increase the number of lives.

merlin.7: You can use the escape key ('ESC') to pause the game.

merlin.8: Now proceed and find the first checkpoint!

merlin2.0:
Hello there! 
I see that you have found the checkpoint.

merlin2.1: Now that you are familiar with some of the basic mechanics, lets introduce some more.

merlin2.2: At the top of your screen, next to the number of coins, is the probability of you being in state 0 or state 1.

merlin2.3: Here, state 1 means the upper layer(the one you are on right now) and state 0 is the lower layer. Sometimes to avoid certain obstacles you would need to transition between layers.

merlin2.4: Next to the probabilities is a sphere called the Bloch Sphere. It is a representation of your current state. Rotations on this sphere's surface allows you to change your state.

merlin2.5: Next to the sphere are angles to help you control your state more precisely. Theta is the angle with the Z axis and phi is the angle with the X axis.

merlin2.6: You can rotate about the X, Y or Z axis by pressing the 'X', 'Y' or 'Z' keys respectively. Pressing these will change your state. These will not work if you stand too close to interactable objects like me :)

merlin2.7: Interacting with objects like collecting coins, standing on checkpoints, getting hit by enemies, etc, will 'measure' you along the Z axis.

merlin2.8: This means that you will collapse to either state 0 or state 1 with the probability shown on the left of the Bloch sphere.

merlin2.9: You can also 'measure' yourself by pressing 'M'. This can be useful if you want to reset your state but there is nothing nearby to interact with.

merlin2.10: Here, walls and the ground do not measure you. Keep in mind that you may get stuck against a wall even if you have a 0.1 probability in that layer so check your probabilities and consider measuring yourself.

merlin2.11: Your goal is to use this mechanic to avoid enemies, collect coins and reach the end of the level.

merlin2.12: Now venture forth and explore this world!

merlin3.0:
Hello there! 
I see that you are getting a hang of being in superposition and getting measured.

merlin3.1: Superposition? Ah I didn't explain it earlier. The states 0 and 1 are what we see in the 'classial' world, think bits in a computer.

merlin3.2: While you were doing rotations, you were neither in state 0 or state 1 but in a combination of both states with a certain probability of being in state 0 and in state 1.

merlin3.3: That is what we mean by being in superposition.

merlin3.4: Anyways, in front of you is a new mechanic. It is a superposition check zone.

merlin3.5: These don't exist in the real world but they are here to force you to use our mechanic and learn about the different rotations :)

merlin3.6: To pass through, you have to change your state to match the phi and theta shown next to the check zone. The fidelity will let you know how close you were to succeeding.

merlin3.7: Don't worry since you don't have to match the theta and phi exactly.

merlin3.8: Well, now I will see you next at the end of the level.

merlin4.0:
Hello there! 
You have made it to the end of this level.

merlin4.1: By touching the flag you can end the level. Now, level 0 hard mode and level 1 have been unlocked in the level select screen.

merlin4.2:
Level 1 introduces new game mechanics while level 0 hard mode uses the game mechanics in level 0 to create a more challenging level.
You are free to choose either. Finishing hard mode levels does not unlock new levels.

merlin4.3: I will appear again to explain new mechanics. See you again!

merlin-lvl1-0.1:
Now it is time for the new game mechanic... 
 Circuit Puzzles!

merlin-lvl1-0.2: To continue forward you have to solve the circuit. On the right there are 2 wires, one above and one below. These represent 2 qubits.

merlin-lvl1-0.3: You may be familiar with |0> and |1> from the hud, but that is for a single qubit. If we have 2 qubits, both in state 0, we write them as |0>|0> or |00>.

merlin-lvl1-0.4: In this puzzle, the upper wire refers to the first(red) number and the lower wire refers to the second(green) number inside |>.

merlin-lvl1-0.5: Your goal is to create the target state shown in text below the wires. To help you with this, the current state is also shown.

merlin-lvl1-0.6: Circles with a letter in them are gates. We use these to change the state of the qubits.

merlin-lvl1-0.7: The X gate changes |0> to |1> and changes |1> to |0>. This is the same as the X rotation but you rotate 180 degrees.

merlin-lvl1-0.8: The Y gate changes |0> to i|1> and changes |1> to -i|0>. This is the same as the Y rotation but you rotate 180 degrees. As you can see, this is similar to X but we get some imaginary number in front of the state.

merlin-lvl1-0.9: The Z gate does nothing to |0> (changes |0> to |0>) and changes |1> to -|1>. This is the same as the Z rotation but you rotate 180 degrees.

merlin-lvl1-0.10: The H(Hadamard) gate changes |0> to 0.71|0> + 0.71|1> and changes |1> to 0.71|0> - 0.71|1>. This is gate is very commonly used to create entanglement with the help of the next gate.

merlin-lvl1-0.11: The C(CNOT) gate is a 2 qubit gate. You have a control qubit and a target qubit. If the control qubit is in state |0>, it does not do anything to the target qubit. If the control qubit is in the state |1>, it performs an X gate on the target qubit, i.e., makes |0> to |1> and |1> to |0>

merlin-lvl1-0.12: Basically, it is a conditional gate.

merlin-lvl1-0.13: You need to stand near the gates, press 'G' to interact and pick up the gate. If you pick up a gate, it will be shown in the HUD.

merlin-lvl1-0.14: After picking up the gate, you need to add it to the circuit. The green blocks with 'Add' written above them will insert the gates to the puzzle.

merlin-lvl1-0.15: The bottom ones add to the bottom wire and the top ones add to the top wire. The Add blocks on the right of the wire will always insert the gate to the beginning of the circuit, and the Add blocks on the left will add it to the end of the circuit.

merlin-lvl1-0.16: Similarly, the 'Del' blocks in red, remove gates from either the left or right of the respective wire.

merlin-lvl1-0.17: To run the circuit there is the 'Run' block in purple and there is a 'Reset' block in orange to reset the entire circuit.

merlin-lvl1-0.18: To interact with any of these blocks, stand close/on them and press 'G'. Beware that if you are too close to any of the blocks or gates, you may not be able to go in superposition.

merlin-lvl1-0.19: The gates and blocks will also measure you and collapse your superposition.

merlin-lvl1-0.20: So that you don't have to keep rememebering, whenever you talk with me further on in this level, I will explain the puzzles at the end. If by then you are comfortable with the puzzles, feel free to click through the dialogue then.

merlin-lvl1-2.0:
Hello there! 
You have now finished 4 puzzle! How was it?

merlin-lvl1-2.1: To give you a break, we are showing something new :)

merlin-lvl1-2.2: As you can see, there is quite a large gap that cannot be crossed.

merlin-lvl1-2.3: Also at the end is a superposition check zone.

merlin-lvl1-2.4: Your task is to be in that state and then teleport to that side.

merlin-lvl1-2.5: Yes, I said teleport. To do this, create the state that you need to be in, and press 'G' at the single orange block on the ground in the lower layer.

merlin-lvl1-2.6: This will then execute the Quantum Teleportation circuit shown on the wires on the right, above the gap. You are represented by the top qubit.

merlin-lvl1-2.7: This circuit is used to transfer your state to another qubit.

merlin-lvl1-2.8: This circuit does have a hint for the final puzzle.

merlin-lvl1-2.9: Well, I will see you before the next puzzle to repeat the information about the puzzle. Enjoy!

merlin-lvl1-2.10: Also, don't worry about what happens to the original qubit :)

merlin-lvl1-4.0:
Hello there! 
You have reached the end of this level.

merlin-lvl1-4.1: By touching the flag you can end the level. Now, level 1 hard mode and level 2 have been unlocked in the level select screen

merlin-lvl2-0.0:
Hello there! 
I see you have come quite far in this game.

merlin-lvl2-0.1:
I would congratulate you, but this isn't over yet. 
Things are about to get... spooky.

merlin-lvl2-0.2:
See that purple gem ahead? That’s no ordinary crystal. 
Follow the superposition check zone and stay in that state. Then, stand on the gem and press 'C'.

merlin-lvl2-0.3: When you do, you will become linked with the gem in mysterious ways.

merlin-lvl2-0.4:
In quantum terms, we call this an entangled state. 
Your superposition becomes the first qubit, and the gem becomes the second.

merlin-lvl2-0.5: The 'C' does a CNOT gate (yes, the one you have used in the puzzles) which connects you two — if you’re on the upper layer (state 1), the gem flips layers too!

merlin-lvl2-0.6: Your HUD will then appear different — instead of just probabilities for 0 and 1, you’ll see the probabilities for the four possible combinations: 00, 01, 10, and 11.

merlin-lvl2-0.7:
Whenever you get measured, both you and the gem collapse together. 
If the gem ends up on your layer, you will carry it with you (non-quantumly).

merlin-lvl2-0.8:
If you carry the gem after measurement and try to enter superposition again, the gem drops out of your hands. 
This part doesn't happen in the real world, only in this game to make you play around with the gem more :)

merlin-lvl2-0.9: So the only way to move the gem between layers is by using single-qubit rotations (your familiar X, Y and Z rotations) — controlling your own part of the state without breaking the connection.

merlin-lvl2-0.10: After carrying the gem (post-measurement), you need to approach the yellow blocks and press 'G', which will remove some blocking obstacles that are present on both layers.

merlin-lvl2-0.11:
Now go ahead, try it out. Entangle with the gem, explore what happens! 
If you fail you can always entangle again.

merlin-lvl2-1.0:
Hello there! 
It looks like you are starting to get familiar with the world of entanglement.

merlin-lvl2-1.1:
So far, entanglement was your friend - it helped you unlock doors to paths unexplored.
Now, let's see how you do when it acts as your enemy!

merlin-lvl2-1.2:
Do you see the giant squirrel ahead? Walk too close to it, and it will kill you! 
But this is an entanglable enemy: if you are in the shaded region around it, you can entangle with it

merlin-lvl2-1.3:
The rules of entanglement will be the same, but beware! 
This time, if the enemy measures at the same level as you, it will spawn where you stand!

merlin-lvl2-1.4: At times, you would want to simply remove this enemy when it blocks your path.

merlin-lvl2-1.5: But at other times, you may need to place these on special pressure plates on the ground, which will open doors.

merlin-lvl2-1.6:
Now go onto this new challenge! 
I will see you soon with our next game mechanic.

merlin-lvl2-2.0:
Hello there! 
I see you have finally learnt how to avoid the entanglement enemy.

merlin-lvl2-2.1: Everything you have done until now was linked to measuring yourself into a particular basis state: 00, 01, 10 or 11.

merlin-lvl2-2.2:
However, now things get even more interesting.. 
Remember those superposition check zones? Imagine those, but for entangled states!
Introducing: the Entanglement-Probability Check Zone.

merlin-lvl2-2.3:
You must make specific probabilities of the 4 basis states to pass these! 
Not an easy task I must say.

merlin-lvl2-2.4:
Thus await your final set of challenges. 
Entangle Away!

merlin-lvl2-3.0:
Hello there! 
Unbelievable that you finally made it here.

merlin-lvl2-3.1:
I fare thee well, hero of this world. 
You have conquered much more than anticipated.

merlin-lvl2-3.2:
If you had fun or learnt something new, please fill the survey for our game! 
(and if you didn't, then definitely fill it) :)

merlin-lvl2-3.3: Farewell and see you again someday!

dialogue1.0: Contrary to our world, walls do not count as observers. They can stop you in both layers.

dialogue1.1: However, a cliff does count as an observer. It either observes you falling or you stay up on the ground.

dialogue2.0: There may come times when there are no observers in the neighbourhood. How then must you continue?

dialogue2.1: You can observe yourself in this case. Press 'M' to observe yourself. Do you not observe yourself in the layer you want? Rotate to increase chances.

dialogue2.2: In the HUD, you find the probability in percents a measurement puts you on top (layer 1) and the probability a measurement puts you on the bottom (layer 0).

dialogue2.3: Are you able to rotate to 100 percent on the desired layer? What about more than ninety percent? You can always try again.

dialogue3.0: These are superposition check zones. Observers like these don't exist in the real world. They can check whether you are truly in the right superposition.

dialogue3.1: As you may or may not have noticed, you can also rotate in two different directions. Where just rotating in x-direction from a pole increases theta, y- and z-direction can influence phi

dialogue3.2: Don't worry if you don't nail the theta and phi perfectly. You can be slightly off the target indicated next to the check zone.
